content.title: Luxury on water at the Fairmont Maldives Sirru Fen Fushi

introduction.small: On the Shaviyani atoll, the villas of the Fairmont Maldives Sirru Fen Fushi are beautiful gems on stilts.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Luxury on water at the Fairmont Maldives Sirru Fen Fushi

paragraphs.text:
Far from Malé's urban frenzy, take a break in a bubble of serenity at the far end of the Shaviyani atoll of the Maldives archipelago. A one-hour ride on a seaplane will take you to the Fairmont Maldives Sirru Fen Fushi and its 120 high-end private villas on stilts. Wooden terraces and wicker roofs mix with an infinity pool that directly gives onto the Indian Ocean, and a bathroom that opens on the outside.
Between white sandy beaches and coral reefs, the location's natural beauty will dazzle you. Amid the charming houses, a one-of-a-kind underwater art gallery appears out of the blue. Artist Jason deCaires' sculptures can therefore be discovered by foot when the tide is low, or with the help of a diving suit when his installation is covered by the sea. When night falls, let your spirit wander from your terrace into the sky, free from visual pollution, as it reveals the shiny Milky Way.

Fairmont Maldives Sirru Fen Fushi
Unit 2B Faamdheyrige
Orchid Magu
Shaviyani Atoll
Maldives

+960 654 8888

www.fairmont-maldives.com ﻿

Rooms: from 14,800 MVR

introduction.small: Take the plunge and discover a heavenly panorama from the skies, during an unforgettable first flight.

paragraphs.text:
Thrill seekers, skydiving enters another dimension in the Maldives. As the previous adventurers land softly and in incredibly precise manner on the sandy end of the atoll, other certified instructors will supervise newcomers ready for their first flight. Take off from Gan Island and jump in tandem at an altitude of 4,000 metres for an impressive freefall over the atolls and the Indian Ocean.
Once the parachute is open and speed is stabilised, you will take control for a few turns and spins – under your monitor's constant supervision – and let the wind carry you. Take the opportunity to gaze at the spread of the archipelago, alternately displaying white sandy beaches, green tropical forests and blue waters lined with fringing reef. Undeniably the most beautiful view of the Maldives!

www.skydivingmaldives.com ﻿

content.title: One&Only Reethi Rah Maldives, alone in the world

introduction.small: You've been cherishing a sweet dream of insular isolation for a while. Nothing in sight, except white sand, lush vegetation and a lagoon to cool off.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: One&Only Reethi Rah Maldives, alone in the world

paragraphs.text:
You've heard that the One&Only experience is always unique - whether in the Bahamas or in Mauritius. No doubt, the Reethi Rah in the Maldives will meet your expectations. After a short private yacht tour, you finally reach your "Water Villa" on stilts, with no one in sight. The 122 bungalows offer intimacy to its guests. After a tour of your suite built with teak wood, thatched roof, and rattan and its private swimming pool, feel free to explore the island... Here, you will understand why the island is named "Medhofinolhu" (“beautiful island” in Dhivehi). The resort has no less than 12 beaches and a stunning infinity pool - not to mention smaller pools scattered all over the island. For breakfast, lunch or dinner, the Reethi Rah offers eight Asian, Italian and French restaurants. If you are worried you might get tired of this idyllic scenery, have no fear: you can go fishing, spend the day on a boat, or try out snorkelling or scuba diving, or get pampered at the spa. Can't you just picture yourself here?

One&Only Reethi Rah
North Malé Atoll
Maldives

www.oneandonlyresorts.com/one-and-only-reethi-rah-maldives

content.title: Soneva Fushi, life on a deserted island

introduction.small: At Hotel Soneva Fushi, picture yourself as a modern day Robinson Crusoe where wildlife comes with luxury.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Soneva Fushi, life on a deserted island

paragraphs.text:
To get to the Soneva Fushi Hotel, take the seaplane from Malé airport to the Baa Atoll. On a site classified as "biosphere reserve" by Unesco, you will fall in love with the turquoise waters of an atoll protected by its own reef. White sand as far as the eye can see and dense vegetation, here, luxury never strays from more ethical concerns: recycling water, using solar panels and protecting biodiversity, are part of the commitments of the hotel. During your stay, you will feel like you are alone on the island. The 25 villas, hidden among the trees, offer full privacy, and have direct access to the beach, where you may have a chance to observe sea turtles. In the evening, enjoy the open air cinema or head to the observatory and touch the stars. Candlelit meals are served on the beach or on a private island, just for you. Another way of reaching for the stars.

Soneva Fushi

Baa Atoll
Maldives

www.soneva.com/soneva-fushi

Room: from 16,485 MVR per night

introduction.small: At Rangali you will be taken off-guard by the spectacular sunset that tints the resort pink and at Ithaa, the famous underwater restaurant.

paragraphs.text:
"Rangali" and "Rangalifinolhu", the names summon exotic images, coconut trees and the good life. The Hilton group chose these two heavenly islands connected by a bridge to set up the Conrad Rangali Island, only 30 minutes from Malé by seaplane. The soft sandy beach is an invitation to step into the water and explore the depths of the atoll with the Nemo Submarine or, more simply, a simple swim with mask and tuba. But first, take possession of your villa, on the beach or on stilts. The hotel is simple and elegant. The furniture designed by Philippe Starck, mixes well with nature, all the villas have direct access to the ocean. At lunchtime, you will discover the other treasure of the hotel: the incredible underwater restaurant named "Ithaa", dine with sharks and other small colourful fish. The next day, in order to recover from this first day full of emotions, give yourself a break at the floating spa. You deserve it!

Conrad Maldives Rangali Island
South Ari Atoll
Maldives
+960 668 0629
conradhotels3.hilton.com/en/hotels/maldives/conrad-maldives-rangali-island

introduction.small: Nautical activities are all on hand in the Maldivian atolls. Surfing, windsurfing or fishing, get ready for an athletic vacation.

paragraphs.text: In the Indian Ocean, the Maldives archipelago is suitable for all kinds of water sports. As a matter of fact, all hotels offer a very wide range of activities. The Maldivians are sailors, thus fishing is one of the main activities. You will easily learn the different techniques, but know that fishing is highly regulated in order to protect some species. If you'd like to move away from the islands, take a kayak, or catamaran, and discover the reefs that surround the atolls. If you're more of an athlete, know that surfing has been developing recently on the island. The North Male Atolls, Male Malé, Addu and Laamu are particularly renowned for their impressive waves. In the evening, when the wind takes up, try out windsurfing or kite-surfing and admire the sunset!

content.title: Cheval Blanc Randheli, chic and custom made

introduction.small: A feeling of pure happiness overtakes you: you have finally found the hotel of your dreams!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Cheval Blanc Randheli, chic and custom made

paragraphs.text:
In the high-end hotel business, perfect service and attention to details are always revealing. At the  Cheval Blanc Randheli Maldives, the staff has only one philosophy: tailor-made. Before your arrival, the hotel will ask you a few questions, your shoe size or favourite sport for instance. After a 40-minute seaplane ride chartered by Cheval Blanc, you will set foot on the island of Randheli in the Noonu atoll, wearing your new espadrilles courtesy of the hotel. A huge work of art, reminiscent of the one travellers find at the Courchevel ski resort in France, welcomes newcomers. Immediately afterwards, discover the 46 sumptuous villas.The Maison was conceived in synergy with the island's natural surroundings, and the architecture naturally blends with the vegetation and lagoon views. There are five restaurants and three bars within the complex. From gourmet kitchen to barbecue on the beach, anything is possible. As proof, a whole island is dedicated to your well-being, with six villas that can be reached by dhonis - a small boat typical of the Maldives - offering various treatments with a menu of Guerlain skin care created exclusively for the Maison.

content.title: Constance Halaveli, elegance in the Indian Ocean

introduction.small: An idyllic setting on a private island brought to you by the first Constance group hotel in the Maldives... So chic.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Constance Halaveli, elegance in the Indian Ocean

paragraphs.text:
Enjoy a short relaxing break at the Constance lounge in Malé after your flight. Then set out on an exotic 20 minute journey aboard a seaplane to the North Ari Atoll and the turquoise lagoon of the Halaveli Hotel. Admire the 86 villas, ocean side or beach side, take your pick! Inside, the Maldivian style beautifully mixes with the signature Constance design (a tad Mauritian). Run to the terrace where a nice surprise awaits you: in addition to direct water access, each bungalow has its own swimming pool overlooking the ocean. Famous for its seabed, this atoll will amaze you with its aquatic fauna. Every afternoon, the diving instructors invite divers on the beach for a departure by boat. On your way out, you will see sea turtles, multi-coloured fish and some small harmless sharks. When you return from your adventure, head to the spa for a relaxing massage before a candle-lit dinner - and music - on the beach at Halaveli.

Constance Halaveli Hotel
Hangnaameedhoo
North Ari Atoll
Maldives

www.constancehotels.com/en/hotels-resorts/maldives/halaveli

introduction.small: Out at sea, large numbers of colourful fish and underwater creatures shimmer under the sun.

paragraphs.text: With its several hundred species, the seabed of the Maldives dazzles all those who have had a chance to dive here. 240 varieties of corals with original shapes have been found in the turquoise waters of the archipelago. More than 1,000 different types of fish swim near the atolls and in the reefs: tuna and napoleon fish mingle with angelfish and clownfish. To preserve all these riches, the government protects many marine species, including sharks and rays. Among the 26 species of sharks (all harmless), the fox shark or the whale shark cruise alongside magnificent sting rays or eagle rays. Turtles also populate these waters, mostly green turtles, which are easily observed, while larger leatherback turtles have become less prevalent. They come lay their eggs on the Maldivian beaches. Seeing the eggs hatch and the small reach the sea is a fantastic moment. If you are lucky enough to see the turtles laying their eggs (November-December), make sure to stay at a distance, don't shine your light towards the animal (egg laying is often nocturnal) and keep as quiet as possible.

content.title: Four Seasons Maldives at Kuda Huraa: better than a dream

introduction.small: Leave technology behind and come re-energise on a private island in the Maldives archipelago.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Four Seasons Maldives at Kuda Huraa: better than a dream

paragraphs.text:
After a 30 minute boat ride from Malé, set foot on the private coral island of Kuda Huraa, where the Four Seasons Maldives spreads out. "Paradise" is an understatement to describe this place. Admire the white sand, crystal clear water, and thatched roofs on the villas. Smell the fragrance in the air: hibiscus, frangipani and bougainvillea... The quintessential scent of vacation. Built by local craftsmen, the 96 villas, bungalows and suites all face the beach and wherever you stay, you will wake up before the infinity of the Indian Ocean right at your doorstep. If you have come here to recharge your batteries, there is no shortage of activities: try surfing, diving or yoga. Finally, the hotel's spa, located on a nearby island accessible only by boat, will provide true rejuvenation with marine salts and algae treatments.

content.title: Love beneath a perfect blue sky

introduction.small: As the archetypal wedding destination, the Maldives will take your happiness even further. Activities for couples, dinners under the stars or relaxing moments by the water, you will leave more in love than ever.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Love beneath a perfect blue sky

paragraphs.text: After the wedding ceremony, the honeymoon proves to be an exceptional moment to extend the magic. If you are looking to spend your honeymoon in paradise, the Maldives archipelago is the place for you and promises unforgettable moments. Each hotel offers a choice of activities: massages at the spa and candlelit dinners, alone on a deserted island, diving for two in an extraordinary underwater world, not to mention mini cruises - with champagne, of course! - to explore the other atolls of the archipelago. By nightfall, the boat will drop you on Vaadhoo Island where bioluminescent phytoplankton turns the water electric blue. A true sea of ​​stars will glitter before your eyes, as bright as your emotions.

content.title: Extravagance and relaxation at LUX* South Ari Atoll

introduction.small: A dreamy décor with the LUX* touch and know-how. For a unique experience, as a couple or with your family.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Extravagance and relaxation at LUX* South Ari Atoll

paragraphs.text:
A light and refreshing breeze blows over the LUX* South Ari Atoll. As you exit the seaplane, you finally get a feel for Maldives' lifestyle you've heard so much about. Late 2016, the LUX* South Ari Atoll completely reinvented itself as a "chic beach house" for demanding hedonists. Mission accomplished! Today the hotel is reborn, more whimsical and modern than ever. The 193 villas are located on the seafront, on a pristine white sandy beach, or on stilts, just above the crisp blue Indian Ocean. There are more than a thousand reasons to choose the LUX*: for its lounge chairs on the beach, its Spa LUX* ME with custom treatments (try the 10-hand massage), for home-made ice cream ICI, outdoor cinema, tree of wishes or cultural workshops. Feel free to indulge in snorkelling and diving, the atoll is home to some divine underwater gems. Finally, know that the hotel has eight restaurants and five bars... You will never be bored!

content.title: Six Senses Laamu Hotel, calling on all senses

introduction.small: Beneath the palm trees and facing the ocean, the Six Senses Laamu is expecting you, beautifully bringing nature and luxury together.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Six Senses Laamu Hotel, calling on all senses

paragraphs.text:
The trip to the Six Senses Laamu Hotel is an experience in itself. It starts with a domestic flight to Male, followed by a boat ride to reach the only resort of the Laamu atoll. Dock on a pristine white sandy beach. On land or on stilts, the villas are built of wood and thatch and are one with the surrounding natural environment. Some even have their own private pool above the ocean. Explore the marine world - diving or snorkelling to see the fish and other corals - or take a boat to meet some dolphins: seeing them leaping from the water is something you will never cease to enjoy. At the end of your day, six restaurants and bars - the majority of which are on the beach - welcome you for a relaxing moment to the sound of the waves in the cool breeze.

introduction.small: Malé reveals another side of the Maldives… in stark contrast with the pace of the rest of the archipelago.

paragraphs.text:
Before boarding your speed boat or taking off on a seaplane to reach your dream island-hotel, enjoy a visit to Malé and discover the most populated city of the Maldives. Located at the southern edge of the North Malé Atoll, in the province of Kaafu, the city of Malé – from Mahal in Dhivehi which means "palace island” – is over 800 years old. Its small streets buzz with people, the only place in the Maldives to display such frenzy. Malé, the economic capital, will provide a glimpse of what the "real Maldives" are, far from the luxury villas and private pools. Even if access is reserved to believers, stop by the Great Mosque, built in the 17th century from blocks of coral, or explore the markets and shop for some lovely crafts. Traditional houses and huge coloured buildings, authentic restaurants and bars without alcohol, Malé will surprise you with its originality.

Malé
North Malé Atoll on Kaafu
Maldives

introduction.small: It's no secret, the seabed of the Maldives offers a magical show of coral reefs and multi-coloured fish.

paragraphs.text:
In the Maldives, all you need is basic snorkelling gear (fins, mask and snorkel) to admire an enchanted show. The archipelago is known as one of the best snorkelling spots in the world, and most of the time, the seabed is just a few kicks away. Some hotels offer diving directly from their deck or from the beach. Others allow you to enjoy a short boat ride to swim closer to the coral where exotic fish, sting-rays and sea turtles live. The Ari Atoll and its magnificent oval lagoon - West of Malé - and the Baa atoll, famous for its deep waters - Northwest of the capital – display all of the Maldives' bio-diversity, but the entire archipelago also offers stunning diversity.
A giant aquarium, accessible to all year-round, with clear turquoise 28 °C (82°F) water, the Maldives offer the best opportunity to discover the seabed.

content.title: Twenty thousand leagues under the sea

introduction.small: The Maldives archipelago stretches over 700 kilometres providing pure diving bliss.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Twenty thousand leagues under the sea

paragraphs.text: The numerous atolls that make up the Maldives archipelago provide an incredible variety of locations, each one more beautiful than the last. Whatever your level, beginner or seasoned, you will enjoy unique moments. Each hotel has its own diving centre, but you can also chose a boat trip that will allow you to dive anywhere. The Maldives offer different types of underwater scenery that you will discover as you hike, palm or bottle. You can swim in passes shaped by currents, on thilas (shallows) inside the atolls, in caves or, if you stay on a private island and the hotel allows it, even within the reef. Corals, fish of all sizes and colours will enchant your underwater exploration. Back on the mainland, you will keep memories of unique encounters and images in mind for a long time.

introduction.small: In the Indian Ocean, the Maldives archipelago overflows with treasures. Among them, the Baros offers a magical experience to lovers.

paragraphs.text:
A mere 20 minutes from the International airport, Baros Maldives is one of the oldest hotels in the archipelago. For the past forty years, this five-star resort has been awarded for its excellent service and has welcomed tourists seeking out the Garden of Eden. From a seaplane, the islet resembles the shimmering coat of a peacock. Once on the mainland, you will be taken by the beauty and sublime of the natural surroundings: villas on stilts, planted on the lagoon, a spa hidden beneath the shade of a tropical garden. Whether you're surfing or diving, the Baros will provide all necessary equipment and numerous outings. Follow a guide to go watch the sea turtles or learn to fish in the reefs. At sunset, make yourself comfortable on the "Piano", an immense wooden terrace set in the middle of the lagoon. There, with your head in the stars, you will share a romantic dinner and enjoy an amazing tuna steak with foie gras, a specialty of Baros. Time is on hold, happiness at hand.

Baros Maldives
North Malé Atoll on Kaafu atoll
Maldives

www.baros.com
